result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D. KUBICHKA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D. KUBICHKA

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
Letter to Steven Kubichka regarding satisfaction form received from Crime Victim Compensation.

It is ordered that the creditor in this matter be amended from Tyler Lachowicz to Crime Victim Compensation Program and the amount of the judgment against the defendant be reduced to a total of $1,350.07.  Since Mr. Kubichka has already paid $860.00 to Tyler Lachowicz, the balance remaining is $490.07.

Letter from Sherri Stark, Crime Victin Compensation Progrm to Judge Bendix.
Letter from Judge Bendix to ADA Griesbach.

$443.00  court costs paid per commitment.
Original commitment returned to Clerk of Court office.
Commitment Payment Notice.

Order for Arrest and Commitment on Failure to Pay costs issued.  Defendant to be committed to the county jail until costs have been paid, not to exceed nine (9) days consecutive to any other sentence or commitment imposed.
Reminder Notice - Final Notice

filed against Steven Kubichka and garnishee, DeepFlex
Garnishment action transferred to 15SC57

Judgment.
It is ordered that the victim in this matter, Tyler Lachowicz, is hereby awarded a judgment against the defendant in the sum of $1,843.72 dollars.

Counsel waived.
The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to misdemeanor battery, contrary to Section 940.19(1).  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for fourteen (14) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 11-13-14 by 6:00 p.m.
Defendant has credit for 1 day.
$443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 01-07-15 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.
The Court further orders a civil judgment of restitution in the amount of $1,843.72 in favor of Tyler Lachowicz.  State to draft.
Amended Information.
Waiver of Right to Attorney.
Victim Impact Statement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
(Defendant returned to the courtroom.  Judge Bendix allowed the defendant to change his report date to 11-14-14 by 6:00 p.m. due to defendant not being able to pay the Huber fees until the 14th)
Minutes.
Plea hearing is reset to 11-07-14 at 10:00 a.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 10-31-14 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to counsel.  Court finds the waiver is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   
Waiver of Right to Attorney.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-10-14 at 4:15 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Counsel waived.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-22-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.
Defendant requests more time to retain counsel.  Initial appearance is reset to 09-08-14 at 4:00 p.m.

Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.
Order denying the petition because the person is not indigent.
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 08-25-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 08-18-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other idenitying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with Tyler Lachowicz.  Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant served.
RE:  Tyler Lachowicz, on 07-04-14.
